Unit Ratios

Mission 10: Unit Ratios

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A D-Rank Gate has been detected. Difficulty: Statistical Analysis. Hunter, prepare to master the Ratio Arts!

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, the greatest Hunters analyze their performance constantly. What's your win-to-loss ratio? How many monsters per hour can you defeat? What's your damage-per-second?

These are all ratios‚Äîcomparisons between two quantities. Today, you'll use sports statistics to master this essential skill!

‚öîÔ∏è Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - Paper and pencil - Optional: Basketball or sports equipment for the practical challenge

üéØ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Rate Calculation - Find a rate when given a specific ratio (6.RP.2) - Example: We paid $75 for 15 hamburgers = $5 per hamburger

üìñ The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

What is a Ratio?

A ratio compares two quantities:

Wins : Losses
Boys : Girls
Cost : Quantity

Writing Ratios: - With a colon: 3:2 ("3 to 2") - As a fraction: 3/2 - With words: "3 to 2"

Unit Rates

A unit rate tells you the amount per ONE unit:

$75 for 15 hamburgers
Unit rate = $75 √∑ 15 = $5 per hamburger

120 miles in 2 hours
Unit rate = 120 √∑ 2 = 60 miles per hour

Scaling Ratios

If the ratio is 3:2, you can scale it:

3:2 (original)
6:4 (√ó 2)
9:6 (√ó 3)
12:8 (√ó 4)

The relationship stays the same!

Video Lessons: - Rates and Ratios Video - Price Unit Rates | CK-12 Foundation

üó°Ô∏è The Quest (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Choose your favorite sport(s) or a variety to complete activities. Math can be found in many different sports. You may want to focus on one or more sports that your children are interested in and help them solve problems using that sport. Listed below are the areas that each grade should be working on and example problems for them to solve.

Problem 1 - Basketball: A basketball team's season goes as follows: 1st game Loss; 2nd game Loss; 3rd game Win; 4th game Win; 5th game Win; 6th game Win; 7th game Win; 8th game Loss; 9th game Win; 10th game Loss; 11th game Loss; 12th game Win; 13th game Loss; 14th game Loss; 15th game Loss; 16th game Win.

What is the ratio of wins to losses?

Problem 2 - Swimming: There are 2 swim teams at a swim meet. One team has 16 boys and 13 girls. The second team has 14 boys and 7 girls. What is the ratio of boys to girls at the swim meet?

Problem 3 - Wrestling: A wrestler has a ratio of 3 wins for every 2 losses. If the wrestler has won 12 matches, how many matches has he lost? Then find out how many total matches he has wrestled.

Problem 4 - Basketball Challenge: See how many baskets you can make in 10 attempts. What is your ratio of baskets made/attempts? How many baskets do you think you would make if you made 20 attempts? Try it. Did you get the same ratio?

üí° Hunter's Strategy Guide

Problem 1: Basketball Season Analysis

Count the games:
L L W W W W W L W L L W L L L W

Wins (W): 8
Losses (L): 8

Ratio of Wins to Losses = 8:8 = 1:1

The team won exactly half their games!

Problem 2: Swim Meet

Team 1: 16 boys + 13 girls
Team 2: 14 boys + 7 girls

Total Boys: 16 + 14 = 30
Total Girls: 13 + 7 = 20

Ratio of Boys to Girls = 30:20 = 3:2

Problem 3: Wrestling Prediction

Ratio: 3 wins for every 2 losses (3:2)

He won 12 matches.
12 √∑ 3 = 4 (the multiplier)

Losses: 2 √ó 4 = 8 matches lost

Total matches: 12 + 8 = 20 matches

Problem 4: Your Challenge

Shoot 10 baskets. Record:
Made: ___
Missed: ___

Ratio: Made : Attempts = ___ : 10

Predict for 20 attempts: ___

Try 20 more! Was your prediction right?

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 10 about ratios and unit rates.
I need to master ratios before my sports statistics assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain what a ratio is and the 3 ways to write one
2. Show me how to find a unit rate (like price per item)
3. Give me 3 practice problems writing and simplifying ratios
4. Quiz me with a problem where I have to scale a ratio up
5. Have me explain how to find equivalent ratios in my own words

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start by explaining what a ratio compares.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

The System awaits your proof, Hunter.

Hunter's Wisdom: Top-ranked Hunters track their stats obsessively. If your success ratio is 3:1, and you want to reach S-Rank with 300 successful raids, you'll need 400 total attempts. Ratios help you plan for greatness!
